elements.title: Kraftwerk Heimbach (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the eight original Francis turbines of Kraftwerk Heimbach (pictured), a hydro-electric power station that opened in 1905 as then the largest in Europe, served until 1974?

elements.title: Gimli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Galadriel's gift of some of her hair to Gimli in The Lord of the Rings has echoes in both English literature and Norse legend?

elements.title: East English River Provincial Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the English River within the East English River Provincial Park has no regulated flow and no pollution, unique in northwestern Ontario?

elements.title: Ruth Huenemann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ruth Huenemann was one of the first researchers to make a connection between socioeconomic status and childhood obesity?

elements.title: Windows 2.0 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Windows 2.0 is the last version of Windows that ran solely on floppy disks?

elements.title: Songbird Sings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Songbird Sings was a series of concerts that focused on Regine Velasquez's music career?

elements.title: Miguel Rivera (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Miguel Rivera sold cosmetics and appliances while working as a jockey?

elements.title: a TV station in Buffalo, New York (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a TV station in Buffalo, New York, owned a 1921-vintage fire engine?
